cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles ENE of Guantánamo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing north-northwest, then turning northwest through the Bahamas and approaching the east-central Florida coast late Thursday, then sliding parallel to the Florida shoreline toward Georgia/South Carolina
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Near or just offshore the east-central Florida coast in the vicinity of Cape Canaveral

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Sebastian Inlet to the Flagler/Volusia county line, including Cape Canaveral
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of Golden Beach to Sebastian Inlet, Lake Okeechobee (south of the port)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast from Palm Beach northward through Jacksonville
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely, and hurricane-force gusts are possible late Thursday night into Friday as the eyewall passes very near the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 3–5 ft above ground possible if peak surge coincides with high tide at Cape Canaveral and adjacent barrier islands.
weather_observation.rainfall: Rainfall totals of 4–7 inches with isolated amounts up to 10 inches could cause localized flooding around port facilities.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, life-threatening rip currents, and dangerous marine conditions will disrupt vessel operations and pilotage.
